body:
To do this this bit of code needs to log and count an error (like other bits of code above) rather than returning it.

This should be quite straight forward.  Fancy having a go?

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/5d6593de4ffc1c492372749565c63209963e1619/fs/operations/dedupe.go#L227-L230

Sure,
how can i get started?

First [install rclone from source](https://rclone.org/install/#install-from-source).

Once you've got it building, have a go at the change I indicated above.

When you've got it working send a pull request!

Let me know if you get stuck on any of those steps and I'll try to help.
Can I pick up this issue?

Sure go ahead,
I'll try with some other issue.

@ncw,
I setup the project and connected with my google drive, initially with:
1 / Full access all files, excluding Application Data Folder.
I ran rclone dedupe, and it ran successfully.

Now, I created another connection with:
2 / Read-only access to file metadata and file contents.
But, as there are no files to dedupe, it does not throw any permission error. How can I create duplicate files to test with?

@ncw, I think the issue is already fixed due to error.Wrap().
In my case, even if there is an insufficientFilePermisson error, it continues with other files and does not terminate.

> But, as there are no files to dedupe, it does not throw any permission error. How can I create duplicate files to test with?

I usually do this in the drive website.



> I think the issue is already fixed due to error.Wrap().
> In my case, even if there is an insufficientFilePermisson error, it continues with other files and does not terminate.

I'm not sure what you mean?  Can you point to some code?

@ncw,
Following is the log. Even if there is no permission, it skips those files, and move to other files. The program is not terminated there.
Log:
>>Sezals-MacBook-Pro:rclone sezalagrawal$ **rclone dedupe first remote2: -vv**
2019/09/06 18:00:43 NOTICE: first.csv: Found 2 duplicates - deleting identical copies
2019/09/06 18:00:43 ERROR : first.csv: **_Couldn't delete: googleapi: Error 403: Insufficient Permission: Request had insufficient authentication scopes., insufficientPermissions_**
2019/09/06 18:00:43 NOTICE: first.csv: Deleted 1 extra copies
2019/09/06 18:00:43 NOTICE: 161.docx: Found 2 duplicates - deleting identical copies
2019/09/06 18:00:43 NOTICE: 161.docx: Deleting 1/2 identical duplicates (MD5 "4781d20aae0496f2d1bb102f31697e58")
2019/09/06 18:00:43 ERROR : _**161.docx: Couldn't delete: googleapi: Error 403: Insufficient Permission: Request had insufficient authentication scopes., insufficientPermissions**_
2019/09/06 18:00:43 NOTICE: 161.docx: All duplicates removed
_.....More files...._
2019/09/06 18:00:44 _**Failed to dedupe with 22 errors: last error was: googleapi: Error 403: Insufficient Permission: Request had insufficient authentication scopes., insufficientPermissions**_
>>

The issue I see, is that even if the permission is not there and file is not deleted, it shows logs like Deleted 1 extra copies, All duplicates removed.

I think the problem is in the merge directories phase rather than the delete duplicate files phase.

So if you create two identically named directories, one without enough permissions for rclone to delete it, then I think you'll see dedupe crash out.


> The issue I see, is that even if the permission is not there and file is not deleted, it shows logs like Deleted 1 extra copies, All duplicates removed.

That isn't ideal, certainly!

issue.title: operations: dedupe on merge continues on errors like insufficientFilePermisson - fixes #3470

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you very much for contributing code or documentation to rclone! Please
fill out the following questions to make it easier for us to review your
changes.

You do not need to check all the boxes below all at once, feel free to take
your time and add more commits. If you're done and ready for review, please
check the last box.
-->

#### What is the purpose of this change?

<!--
-->
Rclone dedupe termintates completely if it encounters an insufficientFilePermisson error on merging duplicate folders and does not check for other duplicate files. The change in this PR logs this error and count of this error instead and continues with other dedupe tasks.
#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

<!--
Link issues and relevant forum posts here.
-->
#3470 
#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-pull-request).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

body:
@ncw, I have raised a [PR](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/pull/3527) for this.
I have also solved bug for messages like Deleted 1 extra copies, All duplicates removed as mentioned above. Should I raise an issue for this and mark it as bug? I can pick it up then.
